body.p: UPPER SQUAW CREEK Miss Esther Stenulson spent Mon- day at C. Ofte’s. Mrs. C. Ofte and irwin spent last Thursday afternoon at S. Severson'6. A number from this vicinity attend- ed the Olson sale at Taylor, last Sat- urday. Misses Alma and Gladys Amundson were callers at Severson’s, Sunday evening. Mrs. Sig. Severson was a visitor at the Harry Haralson home in your city last Sunday. Mrs. Alvin Engebretson and daugh- ter Phyllis, spent Friday afternoon at Stubrud’s. Archie and Leonard Thompson were at La Crosse with a load of to- bacco, Monday. Mr. and Mrs. Sig Severson attend- ed the Aid at Halvorson’s, at Pine Creek on Friday. Mrs. Ed Thompson went to Nece- dah Sunday to visit her daughter Mrs. Rottler and her family. Mrs. C. Ofte entertained our teach- ers, the Misses Johnson and Person, for supper Monday evening. Mr. and Mrs. Mark Engebretson and Adolph Olson and family were visitors Sunday at Geo. Slosser’s. Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Collum of Alma Center attended church here on Sunday. They called on Grandma Thompson after the services. Louis Stein, Mrs. P. Stubrud and son Glen were at La Crosse Tuesday of last week, the latter going there to see Dr. Jones for a foot ailment. Mr. and Mrs. Roy Haralson were at Taylor last Thursday and Friday assisting with the work at Olson’s for their sale on Saturday. There was a very large crowd. Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Anderson en- tertained several of their neighbors at a Bingo party Saturday evening. A good lunch was served and all en- joyed a pleasant evening. Carl Knutson and family of Spring- field have rented the Kelner farm for the coming season. J. Paulson and family who have resided there are planning to move out soon.
